posts.content: Therapy is great when you're receptive and not depressed, all the tools they teach you are to hemp in the situations that don't stop, breathing, counting, colors, mindfulness..... it all it's great when you're not in the state, a lot of us have been in therapy for years but doesn't change how I can be happy before I got to sleep and wake up emotionally depressed for weeks along with anxiety and all else that comes woth it..... sometimes finding a person or thing to live for is what helps.... in my case my father is what keeps me going when he leaves this earth hopefully I'll find something else

posts.content: I tried taking my life 3 times. My friends told me they always thought I was doing better because I seemed so happy. I was happy because it was ending. Obviously Iâ€™m still here and Iâ€™m glad I am, but as someone who has been so bad they had to be hospitalized, please keep an eye on your friends, and if they donâ€™t make it please donâ€™t take it personally. You are probably the reason they made it so long in the first place.

posts.content: 'But if only they had talked to me I could have helped...' that's the biggest line of BS from those that don't live with this. No you wouldn't. They have asked, but you were too busy, or just don't want to deal with their issues'. They know you see them as a burden, but reached out anyways. GTFOH with your 'it's selfish nonsense'
posts.label: suicidal ideation

posts.content: I can't imagine feeling confident enough to tell someone it's okay to unalive yourself. Life's hard enough, I can't imagine having the strength or courage to leave my kids behind in this world. Every down shaped me into the person I am. Everything that ever showed me pain, also showed me the reason why I'll never get to those points in my life again. We could be homeless, in jail, and the whole world can be against us. That come back will provide the strength you need to continue. It can't get any worse than it already is unless you actually fucked yourself then you gotta eat your lesson, and come back mentally stronger. Life is special every single day. Being able to see anyone we love be happy is way more important than money. Being the change is way more better than becoming a percentage of a statistic. Keep fighting. Mental health is real.
posts.label: suicidal ideation

posts.content: I struggled with depression, SH, suicidal thoughts, etc for years.I have been living in freedom now for for close to 5 years. There is hope. There is another side to what you are feeling. Finding people to open up to and be transparent with was a game changer. Jesus can and will move mountains. Itâ€™s doesnâ€™t always look like how or when you expect it to but looking back I would not change my experience for anything. I am who I am today because of it.

posts.content: I never thought my life would lead me to a place where I could genuinely say I am living without an anxiety disorder. I am living without depression. I am living without Complex-PTSD and I get to HELP OTHER PEOPLE DO THAT! Like, holy shit! I get to make a life and living out of helping other people with their own healing journeys and that has been more meaningful than anything I could have ever hoped.
